Class JoiningPhaseData

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.view.GamePhaseData
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.view.JoiningPhaseData
public class JoiningPhaseData extends GamePhaseData
Represents the client-side state during the joining phase of the game. This phase includes all interactions prior to the actual gameplay, such as:
  • Choosing the connection type (RMI/Socket)
  • Setting the username
  • Creating or joining a game
  • Selecting color and level
The JoiningPhaseData keeps track of available matches and player colors (as provided by the server), as well as user choices. This class is used in conjunction with a VirtualServer to send commands and set session-related data.

    • JoiningPhaseData

      public JoiningPhaseData()
      Constructs a new JoiningPhaseData and initializes the default state to CHOOSE_CONNECTION. Initializes empty maps for available matches and player colors.

  • Method Details

    • notifyListener

      public void notifyListener()
      Description copied from class: GamePhaseData
      Notifies the listener that the internal state has changed.

      This method is abstract and must be implemented by each subclass to specify how updates should be propagated to the UI.

      Specified by:
      notifyListener in class GamePhaseData

      public JoiningPhaseData.JoiningState getState()

      Returns:
      the current joining state

    • updateState

      public void updateState()
      Updates the state to the next logical step, based on the current state.

      If the current state is CHOOSE_NUM_PLAYERS, it transitions directly to GAME_SETUP. Otherwise, it moves to the next enum value in the sequence.

      Notifies the listener after state update.
      Overrides:
      updateState in class GamePhaseData

    • setState

      public void setState(JoiningPhaseData.JoiningState state)
      Explicitly sets the joining state and notifies the listener.
      Parameters:
      state - the new state to enter

    • actualizePreviousState

      public void actualizePreviousState()
      Stores the current state as the previous state.

      public boolean isStateNew()

      Returns:

    • setUsername

      public void setUsername(String username)
      Sets the username for the current session.

      This is typically used before the session is fully established (e.g., during the username selection phase).

      Parameters:
      username - the username to assign

    • setServerMessage

      public void setServerMessage(String serverMessage)
      Sets a message received from the server and updates the state accordingly. This method is used to revert the UI state to a previous user input prompt after a failed action, such as an invalid username, game setup issue, or color selection conflict. For example:
      • If the state was USERNAME_SETUP, it reverts to CHOOSE_USERNAME
      • If the state was GAME_SETUP, it reverts to CREATE_OR_JOIN
      • If the state was COLOR_SETUP, it reverts to CHOOSE_COLOR
      Overrides:
      setServerMessage in class GamePhaseData
      Parameters:
      serverMessage - the error or feedback message received from the server

    • handle

      public void handle(ServerAction action)
      Accepts a ServerAction and delegates to it the logic for loading or modifying this JoiningPhaseData instance.

      This follows the Visitor Pattern, where the action knows how to apply itself to the data it operates on.

      Specified by:
      handle in class GamePhaseData
      Parameters:
      action - the action to process

    • isJoiningPhase

      public boolean isJoiningPhase()
      Indicates whether this phase data corresponds to the joining phase.
      Overrides:
      isJoiningPhase in class GamePhaseData
      Returns:
      true since this is indeed the joining phase
